description: The pop star caught the top spot while her other single, “Espresso,” is still holding strong at No. 4 on the Billboard Hot 100. Meanwhile: yes, Taylor Swift’s The Tortured Poets Department is still No. 1 over on the Billboard 200 albums chart — we’re at week nine and counting.
title: Sabrina Carpenter scores her first No. 1 single with 'Please Please Please'

description: There’s something about the shadowy moral recesses of crime and suspense fiction that makes those genres especially appealing as temperatures soar. Here are four novels that turn the heat up.
title: 4 crime and suspense novels make for hot summer reading

description: Pulitzer Prize-winning New Yorker critic Emily Nussbaum's book is a near-definitive history of the genre that forever changed American entertainment.
title: 'Cue the Sun!' is a riveting history of reality TV

description: If Donald Trump is reelected, his administration probably couldn’t stop the country’s transition away from fossil fuels. But any slowdown could have big impacts on climate change.
title: A second Trump term could slow the shift from fossil fuels as climate threats grow

description: In a new interview, Questlove reveals why Drake vs. Kendrick was so triggering, how he regained his passion for hip-hop and what to expect from the new Roots album.
title: In an industry of conformity, Questlove remains a hip-hop iconoclast
